name: F# Matlab Type Provider
tagline: A (not yet complete) Type Provider for Matlab in the spirit of the R Type Provider
body:
### What to expect

For 1.0 I want to have support for most Matlab types and functions.  Currently it just allows you pull in a few types of variables after you connect.  It's highly unstable and under heavy work.  You should probably just wait a week or two for the initial release.

### Requirements

* Matlab 2013a (currently uses strjoin quite a bit)
* Visual Studio 2012

### Current Capabilities

* Access non-complex Values, Matrices and Vectors in a strongly typed fashion. 

### Known Problems

* The current communication interface is COM, and I expect this puts a limit on the size of things.  I hope to be moving to the dll interface once I get things going a bit more.  In the long run I'd very much like to be able to support MacOS and Linux.

### Getting Started

Add the following parameters to your Matlab 2013a shortcut:

`matlab.exe -automation -desktop`

This will allow you to keep a Matlab session open while you connect and disconnect with Visual Studio. Then just access vars like so from inside of Visual Studio: 

`let xFromMatlab = Matlab.COMTypeProvider.Var.X`
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
